sentences: François-Louis Perne, also known as François Perne (4 October 1772 – 26 May 1832), was a French composer and writer on music.
François-Louis Perne was born in Paris.
In 1792, he became a tenor in the chorus of the Opéra National de Paris, where he remained until 1799, when he became a contrabassist in the orchestra.
In 1811 he was appointed professor of harmony at the Paris Conservatoire as a successor to Charles Catel.
He later became general inspector of the Conservatoire in 1816 and librarian in 1819.
